content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Suggestion: Decrease the length of description for fastest mode.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It has a nice story, and clear description.
I updated the description, and I think now it's clear enough to be accepted.

I find the description not very clear. I had to read your solution to understand. (I'm not a native English speaker, so it may be the reason)

"The dogs are walking by their master. But if they saw another dog, they immediate run to the target."
I don't understand what you meant by that. Does it mean that in some cases the dogs don't run to the target ? If that is the case, then I don't understand in which case they run to the target, and how it affects the solution.

Also in your examples, you give the length of the leashes, which is not given explicitly in the input. I think it's a little bit confusing.

And I see in the solution that if only one dog reaches the target, the answer is "Frustration", but it is written nowhere. I think you should explain that.

It is a very easy puzzle but you have made it difficult by adding unnecessary details. 

For example you can just say the leash is curled up with a diameter d and curls n. Distance of target from the dog is t.
The speed, masters and other such stuff is not required in description.

You could make it a bit difficult by asking which dog reaches first.

I see many views, any Downvotes, but not much constructive critics. 

is it too difficulty for a Clash of Code? Should i make it as a normal Puzzle?
Please talk to me...

❌ Rejected the contribution.
Comment: The variables are not well explained, we don't really know what they mean. I still don't know what "windingcount" is and how to use it...
@Downvoters: No problem, feel free to downvote the Clash, but please send a short message, why. So I can learn for the future!
Could you tone down the wording and use "fight" instead of "massacre"? Thanks.

Hi there!
This is my first ClashOfCode. I tried to make one, that is simple to solve, but with a little "Math" inside.

@Native English speakers: Please help me with your English, because mine is very poor, and so something may described unclear.

Every critics are welcome. Positive, negative but at most constructive!

Or even "opportunity to play together" instead of "fight" or "massacre". Dogs are normally naturally sociable...when it is not the case it is due to masters that are just stupids and not able to well educate their dogs.
And replacing "Peace" by "Frustration", "massacre" by "game".

Sorry, I'm not a native English-speaker, so maybe I don't know the exact Word. But you can Help me to make it better.
Because you come from Switzerland, I describe it in German, hoping you are from the German-Speaking part:

Es geht um eine sogenannte Zugleine. Da wird die Leine via Feder auf einer Rolle innerhalb des Leinengriffs aufgerollt. Diese Rolle hat den Durchmesser "diameter" und "windingcount" steht für die Anzahl der Wicklungen, die die Leine um die Rolle nimmt, wenn sie ganz eingefahren ist. Verständlicher?
Bitte hilf mir es besser auszudrücken. Danke!

I didn't downvote, but I've been checking in on this problem because it does seem interesting. Honestly, even with the added explanation of what "windingcount" means, I still don't really understand what it is or how it affects the problem. Also, I'm not sure I understand how what the relevance of "distance" is exactly. How do you know when the dogs see each other? If one dog's distance from the target is significantly shorter and they reach the destination before the others are within range, are they therefore excluded from further consideration? I think the way it's currently explained leaves a lot up to interpretation.

If I were to take a guess, I'd say the reason behind the downvotes is that people simply don't understand the problem clearly. I think what you really need is one or two examples worked out in detail, perhaps one ending in "Frustration" and another ending in a "Big game". 

Best of luck.

Thanks for your constructive comment.

You told me the words, that I don't found. I change my "stumbled English" immediately. :-) 

Your addition which dog reaches first, is a good idea. I will think about it, but in actually have no much time. Maybe in a view days, I can implement it.

Thank you for your suggestions.

My problem is the same as yours: I'm not al native English speaker too. So my word are sometimes not perfect.
I now changed a little, with the tips from madmax7874.

The Examples are added a view days ago, because another commentator told me, that this would be a good idea.
But should I tell every little calculation step there, with Pi, with radius etc...? I think there should be a little to think left.

Yes, if only one reaches the target the dog can't play with another dog an is frustrated.

Great job, I have to thank you very much!

Previously I didn't knew that other could improve my Clash? Are you something like a Moderator?
If you have played 50 clashes you can edit pending contributions: https://www.codingame.com/playgrounds/40701/help-center/approval-process

I find the description more clear as it is now.

For the example, maybe you could say for example if d is 4 cm and n is 16, then the full length of the leash is about 2.01 m, and then continue the example as you did before. Like that, we know that the length comes from d and n but you don't give the formula.
That's just and idea.

Otherwise, your contribution is pretty good.

I think now, with the improvements from justhalf, I don't change anymore.
Thank you for your engagement!

The "speed"-Info was added, because another commentator asked whether it is relevant, if one dog is earlier at the target.

The masters and the other stuff is only a little story around the problem. Like one in School... not only pure numbers. :-)

In fastest mode its not ideal to have a some story because coder wants to finish it as fast as possible. 

In your question it does not matter which dog reaches first and when so giving any information on speed is not required.

Also - "The dogs are walking by their master. But if they saw another dog, they immediate run to the target." is also not required.

So you can remove these lines and examples as well, cause there will be 1 sample test case.

Now I removed like you told me.

The "does not matter which dog reaches first" and the Examples had been added because other commentators wanted them.
No I removed them, hoping the next one didn't miss these lines...

Thank you very much for your comment!

Now I replaced the name of the variable "windingcount" with "CountOfWindings", tried to do a little more explanation and added two Examples, like you described.

What I want to describe it  a retractable dog leash like this one:
https://m.media-amazon.com/images/I/71Q-nE8BViL._AC_SL1500_.jpg

But there is still unclear for me, what words are really correct. 
Is there a rope/cord/wire/(?) winded/twisted/wrapped/spooled/coiled/(?) around a coil/cylinder/spool/(?) in the head/case/handle/box/(?) 
:-O
Sorry, I'm not from the German part

OK, np, so I try to explain it with my poor English.

There is a Dog-leash like this one:
https://shop.haustiertraum.ch/detail/trixie-flexi-new-classic-gurt-kopie/

In the "Head" is a coil with a spring. The cord is winded around the coil. The dog can pull the cord off, or when the dog comes nearer, the spring coils the cord up.
So the "windingcount" is the count of windings the cord makes around the coil, when the cord is in "zero-position".
Yes, your suggestions are better!

Better now?

I hoped for some technical critics, or some better explanations or so.

But ok, if you want me to softwash it...

The most dogs, I can see on the streets, first bark to each other, long before they play.
And: When they "play", sometimes it looks like a massacre.

Your comment confirms your obvious ignorance of dogs.

Hier ist ein kurzes Video (auf Deutsch), das das „Massaker“ zwischen den Hunden vorstellt : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NVriZKnbBQo

Guten Wochenendausklang :wink:

Ich dachte es geht hier um Programmieren!  

Wenn Euch mein Kopfkino zu martialisch ist, ok. Ich habe nun doch all Eure Wünsche erfüllt.
Aber bitte versuch nicht mich oberlehrerhaft in die Hundeschule zu schicken. Ich werde mir das Video nicht reinziehen - hülfe eh nichts, bin ja ein Ignorant.
Da hilft auch Dein Smiley nicht.

Ich kann gerne auch "Hund" gegen "Kampfhund", "Löwe", "Alien" oder "Roboter"  ersetzen, wenn es Dich glücklich macht. 
Sähe nur komisch aus, wenn man mit einem Alien an der Leine durch die Stadt wandert...

Thank you for making the changes. I understand that the focus should be on programming; however, making the puzzle more presentable helps increase the chances for it to be accepted and approved, and helps bring smiles instead of some negative emotions to future players of this clash.

Well, calm down, ok? You should work a little bit on your susceptibility and your nervousness... and calmly read 5DN1L's last answer to understand why it's better to change a few words. And it doesn't hurt to learn a little in other areas than programming, it's not going to kill you huh.

@ 5DN1L:
I have chosen "massacre", because I thought it is more interesting. Look at the Newspapers: Bad news are more printed/read than peace, joy and pancakes-news.
And maybe I was influenced by the Puzzle I solved in that days: "Codes vs Zombies" ...

@ b0n5a1:
Now it drifts to Non-Topic. Feel free to teach me via private messages, Master.
